awd_titl_txt: CSR: Small: Collaborative Research: System Research on Persistent High-Dimensional Data Access and Its Application to Semiclassical Molecular Dynamics Simulation
awd_abstract_narration:
High dimensional data arise in many scientific studies. High-frequency accesses of large disk-resident high dimensional datasets pose both I/O and algorithmic challenges for high access efficiency.  Investigators of this proposal are faced with high dimensional data from semiclassical molecular dynamics studies that need to be accessed repeatedly at a very high frequency during the simulation, and in some simulation studies the datasets can be far larger than the memory capacity. 

The project addresses the challenge of large high-dimensional datasets by proposing a middleware system for fast access of storage-resident high dimensional data, with easy-to-use APIs for data organizing, indexing, search, and I/O latency hiding. In order to enable fast searches with low memory footprint, various indexing structures are explored and a new locality preserving tree (LPT) is proposed. Furthermore, the project exploits specific data access patterns in dynamics studies for I/O latency hiding through overlapping of computations with I/O's, enabled by a small set of easy-to-use programming constructs for non-blocking read/write operations that are under development for further reduction of data access time. The developed non-blocking APIs are compatible with hard disk drives (HDDs) and hybrid solid state drives (SSDs) and HDDs. In addition, an SSD-based I/O accelerator is developed and integrated with non-blocking APIs.

This project tackles important and challenging problems for accessing large high-dimensional data sets, which has applications beyond semiclassical molecular dynamics simulations. The investigators will leverage the research efforts to motivate and educate students.  To broaden the impact beyond project participants, courses will be enhanced with knowledge, insights, and materials obtained from the research, with careful adaptation as course materials and course projects.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The fast advancement in data generation/collection capabilities has lead to a deluge of data, however data understanding cannot adequately catch up in many cases.  In addition to the volume and velocity, the complexity of data also poses challenge to big data processing and understanding.  One of the challenges of data complexity is high dimensionality.  In many problems, the multi-dimensionality of the data comes from multiple features that combine to characterize essential properties of the systems/objects under study, or multiple influencing or contributing factors of an outcome.  The importance of high dimensional data is well reflected by the plethora of research activities. For big datasets, high dimensionality brings bigger challenges. 

 

Intellectual Merit.

In this project we tackled challenges of organizing, searching, and accessing disk-resident big sets of high-dimensional data from scientific studies including semiclassical molecular dynamics studies and other studies. Outcomes of this project include algorithms and software that addresses the challenge of large high-dimensional datasets to speed up the data organizing, searching, and access of large high dimensional data, including storage-resident persistent data. To identify fast search methods with low memory footprint and low programming complexity, various indexing structures were explored including  single-dimensional data projection and a successive data bi-partitioning based search method. Furthermore, we also developed a small set of simple and user-friendly API library for non-blocking I/O access to enable overlapping of I/O cycles with CPU computation, which allows dynamics simulation codes to exploit data access patterns for I/O latency hiding through overlapping of computations with I/O?s for further reduction of data access time. The developed non-blocking APIs are compatible with hard disk drives (HDDs) and hybrid solid state drives (SSDs) and HDDs.  Developed data organizing and searching algorithms and software were applied to quasi-classical and semiclassical molecular dynamics, and were also found to be potentially useful for other studies involving high-dimensional big data.

 

Broader Impact. 

This project tackles important and challenging problems for organizing, searching, and accessing high-dimensional big data, which has applications in a broad range of scientific studies. Outcomes with broader impacts including motivating and training of students through participation in the project, as well as undergraduate and graduate courses for broadening the impact beyond project participants, where the courses included knowledge, insights, and materials obtained from the research, with careful adaptation as course materials and course projects. Broader impact outcomes also include data, software, and publications out of the project, and a project website for disseminating the data and software. The url of the project website is http://www.myweb.ttu.edu/yzhuang/index_files/SEERDAM_index.htm.

 


Last Modified: 10/26/2021
Modified by: Yu Zhuang
